content: basic sunburst square pillow pattern ***this pattern is available for free on my website at https //www nautikrallcrochet com/blog-freepatterns/basicsunburstpillowpattern a beginner friendly easy crochet pattern for those wanting to dip their toes into the art of pillow making these squares are just slip stitched together and the result is a perfectly squishy pillow you can feel good about not only are the colour options endless-the sunburst squares always fill me with joy work them up solid coloured for an easy carefree crochet experience or change up the colours each round and create a multicolored masterpiece this pattern is written for pillow sizes 14 x 14 and 18x 18 in dk weight yarn i used hue loco dk 100% sw merino 230yds/100g to make the 18 pillow shown in green the 14 pillow was made with ravenswood fibre co dk 85/15% merino/nylon 246yds/100g and a size 4 5mm hook -any dk weight yarn will work as long as gauge is met there is also an additional yarn colours section on the last page of the pattern showing the pattern made with a sewrella oopsie bundle and a worsted weight option from the frosted stitch pattern will include - yarn amounts/quantities - gauge - stitch glossary - printable pdf - schematic for pillows - written instructions for sunburst granny square - video tutorial for the sunburst granny square used the slip_stitch method of joining squares and seaming for the pillow panel happy crocheting everyone l m ***this pattern is written in english only*** the pattern the photographs and video tutorials in this document are the property of nautikrall crochet you may sell items you make from this pattern but may not sell reproduce or distribute this pattern in whole or in part as your own copyright © 2023 nautikrall crochet all right reserved
